tanzanian.text: A sheep cannot bleat in two different places at the same time.
Two ants do not fail to pull one grasshopper.
The earth is not an inheritance of our fathers, nor one for our sons.
The turtle does not suffer when running.
Those who do not listen to the voice of the elderly are like trees without roots.
You do not beat a drum with one finger.
A child's lie is like a dead fish in a pond that in the end, always comes to the surface, explains his mother.
A fool is like a wanderer lost on a path.
A friend is someone who walks by your side.
A village without elderly is unhappy.
Alone a youth runs fast, with an elder slow, but together they go far.
Disease and disasters come and go like rain, but health is like the sun that illuminates the entire village.
Happiness is like a field you can harvest every season.
For a rash to heal, you must stop scratching it.
In anger there is no intelligence.
Little by little the mouse finishes the hide.
The son of a zebra also has stripes.
The roaring lion kills no game.
The robin and the wren are God's cock and hen; the martin and the swallow are God's mate and marrow.
To be without a friend is to be poor indeed.
We start as fools and become wise through experience.
Do not make the dress before the child is born.
Do not mend your neighbor's fence before seeing to your own.
Even flies have ears.
Even the night has ears.
Events follow one another like the days of the week.
Everything has an end.
We praised the bride, and she was found pregnant.
Who came back from the grave and told the story?
You should have done it on the wedding night, you fool.
One hundred alcoholics are better than one gambler.
Pretend that you are crazy, you will live.
The anger of a woman is mighty and the devil's trickery weak.
The bald woman boasts of her sister's hair.
The multitude is stronger than the king.
The only difference between the cucumber and water is the moving of the teeth.
There is no blindness but the blindness of the heart.
They asked the female cat why her kittens were of different colors; she said she is embarrassed to say no.
They asked the mule who his father was.
They ate our food, and forgot our names.
How lovely is the sun after rain, and how lovely is laughter after sorrow.
If he gives you a rope, tie him with it.
If my belly is of glass, I will fill it with bread and chicken; if it is a closed cellar, I will fill it with cockroaches.
If someone hits you with a stone, hit him with bread; your bread will return to you and his stone will return to him.
If the full moon loves you, why worry about the stars?
If the tail of the dog can save me, I don't care about its stench.
If there is any profit in partnership, two will share a woman.
If you are ugly, be winsome.
If your friend is honey, don't lick him thoroughly.
No one will say, "My father is incontinent." Everyone will say, "He is a man of advice and wisdom."
A bull went to impregnate a cow, and he came back a fetus.
After I saw what my mother did, I will never trust a widow.
Because he has so many trades, he is unemployed.
Don't trust the horses if they run away, or the whores if they repent.
He ate one fig and he thought the autumn had come.
He said, "My uncle is the horse."
He who is covered with other people's clothes is naked.
The tail of the cow watches to the right and left.
When the lion gets old even flies attack him.
He who spends a night with a chicken will cackle in the morning.
He who wants to be famous will have many a sleepless night.
Hit him with a bean, he will break.
In the world all things are two and two.
Little by little, a little becomes a lot.
One who bathes willingly with cold water doesn't feel the cold.
The wind does not break a tree that can bend.
Those who arrive to the spring first, drink the purest water.
You can run away from your elder, but she'll still out-think you.
The cultivator is alone, but those who eat are many.
Where the rooster crows there is a village.
She who doesn't say it to you isn't your friend.
Hunger pushes the hippopotamus out of the water.
Once the mushroom has sprouted from the earth, there is no turning back.
The chief's wisdom is a mesh of old stories, good and bad.
Sticks in a bundle are unbreakable.
The talker talks and causes death in his family.
A wise person will always find a way.
Do not forget what is to be a sailor because of being a captain yourself.
Many hands make light work.
tanzanian.description: If a lot of people carry a heavy object, it does not feel heavy. That is the general meaning of this proverb. If everyone works together to complete something—like cleaning, painting or group projects—then each person has less to do. More importantly, the job will be completed much more quickly.

tanzanian.text: A boat cannot go forward if each rows his own way.
A person who is not disciplined cannot be cautioned.
Sweet words lure the snake out of its cave.
tanzanian.description: If you wish to achieve an aim, you must be tactical.

tanzanian.text: You overcame the rain, but what about the dew?
tanzanian.description: This proverb could be first of all a gentle reminder for people who may feel tempted to think that they have already achieved so much in this life that no effort is needed from them any more. Achievements are only but openings towards greater challenges. Technical achievements for instance do help greater mobility for good for people all over the world, but they raise the perilous task to protect our entire planet. As for leaders who may think they have already reached a status so high that they need no longer make any more effort ~ ~ they are forgetting that they are generating cracks from within themselves that will most certainly cause bitter disappointments.

tanzanian.text: A Tutsi liked to warm himself by the fire someone else took the bull.
Help me during the flood, and I will help you during the drought.
I pointed out the stars and moon to you, but all you saw was the tip of my finger!
Make some money but don’t let money make you.
The humble pay for the mistakes of their leaders.
If you are filled with pride, then you will have no room for wisdom.
Do not mend your neighbor’s fence before seeing to your own.
One who bathes willingly with cold water doesn’t feel the cold.
The robin and the wren are God’s cock and hen; the martin and the swallow are God’s mate and marrow.
